QuestDef.Description:
Rihossa leads you inside the sanctuary, where you find a single great room, with a statue of the Oracle in the center. "This place was consecrated by... my brethren...." He pauses for a moment. "To the Oracle's guardian, the golem Tyundii, who fell in battle against the Titans. When he was destroyed, they gathered the shattered remnants of his body, and brought them here." The Padar walks to the wall, and presses a carving, which slides to one side, revealing a hidden chamber. From it, he pulls a piece of polished stone. "A fragment of great Tyundii - and of the map we seek."
You frown. "The golem's body? A map?"
"Indeed. Tyundii was guardian to the Temple precinct, whose boundaries were inscribed on his body. A map of the Temple's location." Rihossa presses another carving. "All we need do is reassemble the fragments of his body, and - " His voice trails off.
"What?" you ask. "What's the matter?"
"It is missing - the piece that was here... " Rihossa presses a third carving, and then a fourth, looking increasingly frantic. "Three pieces are missing! Without them, we cannot read the runes. Without them, we cannot find the Temple."
"Padar. Look...there is power still in the stone. The spell of animation - the Anima T'sal Anima." Shirayne touches the rock to her amulet, which begins to glow a light blue.
"Yes! The Spell." Rihossa closes his eyes, and concentrates a moment. "Thank the Five - they are not far, the three fragments we need. All nearby - all within marching distance of the Crying Mountain - Kair Na Morne. It lies to the East, my Lord Relias."
A golem as a map, huh? Well, you have no choice but to trust this fellow. At least it's nice to see him not look so glum for a change.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: Only the missing pieces of the golem can tell us the Temple's location. We must find them.

Objective.Text: Collect the 4 pieces of Tyundii. 3 are missing and can be found near Kair Na Morne - the crying mountain.

QuestDef.Description:
Just outside the town of Cumbrana, Shirayne's amulet begins to glow... a fragment of the Golem, you realize, is near. You enter the village, and are welcomed by its leader, the Khag, and he holds a feast in your honor. Your noble ego properly soothed, you sit down next to Shirayne and make small talk. She looks over at you and smiles.
As you break bread with the Khag and his men, your gaze then wanders to a nearby cart, loaded with wooden chests, bolts of cloth, casks of ale...and something else. A large fragment of polished stone. A piece of the golem Tyundii. The Khag notes your interest.
"You like my pretty stone, Lord Relias? How it shines? I would give it to you, but alas, it is promised already to the men of Kraxis, who have offered us valuable weapons in trade."
Before you can reply, Rihossa interjects sharply. "The stone is not yours to give. It is a fragment of the golem Tyundii, stolen from the Shrine of the Protector. You must return it to us at once."
At Rihossa's words, all conversation around the great table stops. You sigh. The monk clearly has spent more time reading ancient scriptures than rubbing elbows.
The Khag's eyes narrow and he turns his gaze to you. "Your Padar, Relias, has just called me a thief." The Khag's words are soft, but carry the veil of warning. "Am I right?"
Rihossa softens his tone. "No, great Khag. I simply ask... in the name of the Five, please return this thing to where it belongs. I apologize for my rough words. The last few weeks have not been kind."
"The Five? The Elemental Lords?" The Khag sneers. "What good can they do for me, and mine? They are dead, or cowering in their lairs. We need swords - shields - axes - the things the men of Kraxis have promised us in exchange for this stone."
Shirayne's hand moves to her weapon. The air is thick with tension.
The Khag relents... slightly. "But I accept your apology, and I will make you a deal, Men of the West. Bring us metal to make our own weapons, and you can have your precious rock."
The Khag rises, and leaves the tent. With that the feast ends. Shirayne rises and returns to her lodgings. You mutter under your breath. Metal huh? Well, it could be worse.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: We do not wish war with the people of Cumbrana. We will bring you the metal you desire.
QuestDef.SuccessText: You have returned to Cumbrana with the Khag's metal. In exchange, he gives you the fragment of Tyundii you need.

Objective.Text: Collect 15 metal, then return to Cumbrana.

QuestConditionDef.CannotCompleteText: You don't yet have the 15 metal the Khag requested.

QuestDef.Description:
An arrow buries itself in the ground at your feet.
A heartbeat later, dozens more follow, till there are a line of them, standing straight up in the ground, forming a fence of sorts.
You look to Shiryane. She appears more impressed than concerned. She's something else, that's for sure...
You scan the hillside before you, seeking the source of those arrows. It takes a second to realize that hidden among the rocks and crags is an immense fortress, a citadel built into a gap in the mountain range. A fortress of ancient, worn stones, some the size of a Capitarran trader's galley, some overgrown with vegetation, all of varying shades of faded, weathered scarlet.
"By the Five," Rihossa whispers. "Redstone."
A handful of soldiers emerge from a hidden vantage point, carrying large, elaborately carved bows. One steps forward - a woman.
"I am Engrid, First Arrow of the Ninety-Nine. Our bows are upon you, strangers. Turn and go back the way you came."
"My name is Relias," you say. "In case you weren't already aware of that. And if this is truly Redstone, I cannot turn back." You explain your quest, but Engrid's expression does not change, not even when you mention Queen Procipinee, or the Oracle.
"Those names mean nothing to me," she says. Tsch. This woman... You set aside your polite manner.
"They are those who will decide our race's future," you proclaim.
"The Ninety-Nine decide our own fate," Engrid says, and yet as she speaks, you note how thin she is. How dark the circles under her eyes, how ragged the clothes she wears. You decide to try a different tactic.
"Better to decide your fate on a full stomach," you say. "I invite you to share our food. We can - "
"We do not need charity," she snaps. Your patience is wearing very thin.
"It is friendship and food I offer. Not charity..."
"We hunger because of the Fallen." One of Engrid's men steps forward. "Their armies have occupied our lands. Besieged the farmers who feed our people."
"We do not want your food, noble Lord Relias," Engrid says. "But very well. If you wish to help us - destroy these Fallen beasts. Then perhaps we can discuss friendship - and your passage through our city, into the Temple Valley beyond."
You have little love for this woman, but besieging the city would be both costly and pointless. You swallow your pride, and agree to saly the Fallen warriors occupying the countryside.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: Your war is ours, dear, sweet Engrid. We'll drive the Fallen from your lands, and then we'll break bread together.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
The Fallen's armies vanquished, you return to Redstone... only to find a pile of rubble where the citadel once stood. Shirayne gasps. Rihossa rushes forward towards the ruins.
"There were... so many of them. So many." An old man shuffles forward. "We could not stop them."
"The Fallen," you say.
"Yes." The old man nods. "Soldiers of Yithril. Led by... a General Skayd."
"We killed many of his army. Those we found out there in the fields. The granaries. They're..."
You fall silent, not knowing what else to say.
"You are Relias, are you not? I know of Engrid's bargain with you, my Lord," the old man says. "I shall fulfill it. Odenvell lies east of here, through the Temple Valley. Come. I will show you." He leads you slowly up the mountainside. Everywhere you go, you see corpses. Archers. Peasants. Soldiers. And then... Engrid herself.
A sickening feeling creeps into your abdomen. You grimace and Rihossa comes to your side. "My lord, are you..." The odor of rotting flesh becomes overwhelming, and you vomit along the side of the road. Shirayne remains crouched, holding her hands over her nose and mouth.
This was not how things were supposed to be. Memories of your father chastising you, once so vivid, have been replaced with new ones of death and misery. The old man's words slice through your moment of contemplation.
"She died refusing Skayd the knowledge he sought. The Temple's location." The old man looks up at you. "But he will find it, soon enough, for it is very close. Just a short ways east. He must not be allowed to desecrate that sacred ground, Relias. You're the only one who can stop them now."
"We will stop him," you say. "I promise."
OBJECTIVES:
* Continue eastward into the Temple Valley, and find Odenvell.

QuestDef.Description:
A tent stands in a clearing in the forest before you, flaps pinned open, a small fire burning nearby. You find a man inside lying on a makeshift cot - a man whose skin is an unhealthy, unnatural shade of gray. A look of knowing concern crosses Shirayne's face.
"Noble sirs," the man gasps, sitting up. As he does so, a tattered, torn book slides from his lap to the ground. As it lands, you note its worn cover bears the faint outline of an eye, traced in white thread. "Thank the Gods you have come. I am Dathal Da Nadda, and I - "
"The Five preserve us!" Rihossa says, and before you can stop him, he dashes forward, picks up the fallen book and hurls it into the fire. "My Lord... that volume... it is the Azana al-Ruzhkan - the Black Quire. An abomination in the sight of man and the Elemental Lords."
"Your Padar is right, my Lord." The man states, weakly. "I have been a fool... working with powers beyond my abilities..."
"So what is wrong with you?" you ask.
The man somehow manages a smile. "I appear to have poisoned myself, Lord. I do not have long, I fear... unless... there is a village to the northwest ... Urwenn. The apothecary's shop - purchase the seeds of the Lannarg plant, he will give it to you as a fine paste... that will cure me. Please my Lord. I beg you."
Shirayne stares intently at you. Everyone awaits your response.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: Fine, fine. We will fetch the antidote from Urwenn for you.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: We have a quest of our own to complete. Sorry.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
It takes nearly an hour for the first effects of the antidote to be seen; another hour past that for the color of Dathal's skin to return to normal. But recover he does, and Shirayne breathes a sigh of relief.
Dathal slowly gets to his feet, and from a satchel near his bed, carefully draws a small dagger.
"This is the blade I poisoned myself with, Lord. It has been enchanted by the magics in the Quire. A single scratch..." he slashes the air with the blade... "will kill, and swiftly. I give it to you, for use on your opponents. Gods have mercy on them."
"These are dark magics, Lord," Rihossa says to you, under his breath. "Nothing good can come from this 'gift'." You look for Shirayne's input, but she waves you off. Hmph.
You weigh the Padar's words, and decide - albeit with some misgivings - to accept the dagger. It is a dangerous weapon, it is true. But as your brief time in the East has already shown you... you travel in a dangerous world as well.

Objective.Text: Search out Urwenn to the northwest, then buy the Lannarg seeds from the apothecary there, and return them to Dathal Da Nadda.

QuestDef.Description:
You come upon a campfire, in front of which sits a man. He starts at your approach, and haltingly stands, which is when you note a bloodstained cloth wrapped around his right leg.
"Easy buddy," you say. "We mean no harm. I am Lord Relias, of Resoln."
"Taevish of Merlayne. Good day to you sir."
"Merlayne. Hmmm... I know that place. We'll take you there, and - "
"I thank you, but I cannot return. Not without what I have been sent to find." He sits back down with a heavy sigh, and motions you to join him by the fire. "I am apothecary to the townsfolk. We are an old village, and before the cataclysm... we drew our water from the great wells underneath our city, filled by springs which flowed from the slopes of Kair Na Morne.
But now those waters have become stagnant. Fouled. They must be purified. An elixir made... grain of the amaranta... viscera of the great timber warg... blood from an ogre's vein..." "Wait, wait, slow down old man..." He shakes his head. "I do this each moon, but this time... as I was returning from the amaranta fields, I was set upon by beasts of some sort. I had to flee for my life. And now I'm here."
"Ogre blood? Warg... 'viscera'?" Shirayne asks.
"Indeed." The man manages a slight smile. "There are oils in each... essential ingredients to the elixir. Without which, my village will not survive. And as you can see..." he gestures to his bandage - "I can no longer fetch these ingredients myself. Will you gather what is needed, great Lord Relias? You, and your company? I would gladly give you a portion of the elixir for your own use as well. It might be useful to you."
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: We'll gather the ingredients for your elixir, Taevish.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: Sorry Taevish, but we're on an important mission. Best of luck.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
You bring Taevish everything he has requested; it does not take him long to make the elixir. Before he leaves for Merlayne, though, he pulls something from his saddlebags.
"I owe you much, Lord - consider these payment." He hands you armor - two bracers, metal cuffs worn on the wrist as protection.
Your eyes widen. "This is... a generous gift. This armor is well-crafted." You run a hand along the inside of the metal, and frown. "They are warm to the touch. Where did you..."
"They are enchanted." Taevish smiles. "Imbued with the fire of Sirdir, the Elemental Lord of Flame. They are called - "
"The Fists of the Sun," Shirayne interrupts. "A thousand years ago, the Dunnadar wore bracers such as these to cross the Ice Plains, when they rode to Imperium in search of Breon's Stone." Now she's just showing off...
"They warmed those warriors then, as I hope they will warm you now, Relias." Taevish bows. "I take my leave of you, Lord." Before you know it, he vanishes into the mist.
What a strange fellow...

QuestDef.Description:
Just as you're about to settle down for dinner, there's a disturbance at the edge of your camp. You crane your neck and see an old man trying to force his way to your campfire. You wave to your men to allow him through.
"Who's in charge here?" the man demands.
"That's me," you say, standing. "Relias, King of Resoln." There's more than a hint of annoyance in your voice.
"Resoln, eh? Never heard of it." The man glares at you. "It's Keir Duggam talking to you, Relias of Resoln. I'm King in my own way, you could say, of the village of Murland. And I could use the help of you and your soldiers here."
The man's accent is so thick you have trouble understanding him for a moment. "Help huh? What's the problem?"
We got snow ogres, King. A couple of 'em settled in right near the river, right where me and mine cast the nets out to fish. Can't hardly do that safely now. We could use a few good swords to clear 'em out. What say you, Relias of Resoln?"
You frown. Snow ogres. Garrotes. Vicious and deadly creatures. You do not like to think of anyone at their mercy, and yet... you have other tasks before you as well.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: Very well Keir Duggam, we'll rid your fishing grounds of these creatures.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: You must find other places to fish, old man. We have other business.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
You bring Duggam proof that you've taken care of the snow ogres that were threatening his fishing grounds; two of their hides, scraped from the corpses. The old man takes them from you with a grunt. You are about to remind him that you risked your life on his behalf - to suggest an expression of gratitude just might be in order - when from a hut behind Duggam a girl steps forward. Her hair is red, and long. Her eyes a bright, shining green.
"My father - " she says with a glare at Duggam - "has little experience with civilized courtesies, my Lord. Allow me to thank you on his behalf - and on behalf of all of Murland."
Her smile is dazzling. You return it, not thinking. "You are quite welcome, milady."
She giggles. "I am no lady, my lord. Darlia is my name. Would you..."
Shirayne glares at you. "We should be going - my Lord."
"Allow me but an hour more of your time," Darlia says. "And I will give you a proper reward." With Shirayne offering a look that could pierce platemail, the girl disappears into the hut with the two garrote hides. She returns shortly with a gift for you.
"A garrote cloak, my Lord," she says. "It will keep your warm - on the coldest of nights. Think of me when you wear it."
One of your men snorts out a laugh. Duggam frowns. Shirayne... Darlia smiles suggestively. Suddenly, things have become very uncomfortable. "I, uhhh..."
You take the garment, and take your leave.

Objective.Text: Bring Duggam at least 2 garrote hides to prove you have taken care of his problem.

GoodieHutType.Name: A Forbidding Darkness
GoodieHutType.Description: Hidden in the shadow of a rockfall lies the entrance to a rank-smelling cavern... an animal lair of some sort.

Treasure.Title: Item Discovered!
Treasure.Desc: In the Garrote's lair you find the staff of a less fortunate adventurer.

GoodieHutType.Name: A Giant's Footprints
GoodieHutType.Description: Leading into the darkness of this mountain cavern are tracks that could be mistaken for human... save for their monstrous, unnatural size.

Treasure.Title: Item Discovered!

GoodieHutType.Name: Umberdroth Lair
GoodieHutType.Description: Dug from the rock and stone itself is a great cavern whose entrance is as large as a tall-masted merchant ship... whatever lives within is not to be trifled with.

Treasure.Title: Item Discovered!
Treasure.Desc: In the Umberdroth's lair, you find odd-looking headgear used as a nest for one of the creature's eggs.

GoodieHutType.Name: Temple of the Darklings
GoodieHutType.Description: A crude shrine dedicated to the demon Samarra, who the Darklings worship as a god.

Treasure.Title: Darkling Dagger
Treasure.Desc: A crude short sword.

GameModifier.Title: Dariun's Gift
GameModifier.Desc: A pilfered sack of Antheran gold coins, bearing the seal of Dariun the Brave.

GoodieHutType.Name: Pilgrims Cairn
GoodieHutType.Description: In ancient times, the Padars would cache supplies in cairns such as these, marking their locations with a pile of rocks, or simple stone arches.

Treasure.Title: Winter Cloak
Treasure.Desc: Spun by the weavers of Grennhelm; intended for pilgrims unaccustomed to the cold of the north.

Treasure.Title: Cavan Bread
Treasure.Desc: Flatbread baked from the rare Cavan mushroom - providing both nourishment and healing to weary pilgrims.

Treasure.Title: Padar's Longstaff
Treasure.Desc: The Padars of old were often forced to defend themselves from fearful, suspicious villagers. The staff was their weapon of choice.

Treasure.Title: Keeran's Helm
Treasure.Desc: A protective helmet, fashioned after those worn by the Dunnadar, Grennhelm's protectors.

GoodieHutType.Name: Morian's Basilica
GoodieHutType.Description: Raised in honor of the Elemental Lord Morian, the ruins of this vast sanctuary may yet contain unexplored passages... and undiscovered treasures.

Treasure.Title: Morian's Gift
Treasure.Desc: An enchanted ring - one imbued with the power of the Elemental Lord himself. It grants the wearer increased attacking ability in combat.

Treasure.Title: Hammer of the Dunnadar
Treasure.Desc: A great mace, marked with the image of the staff and the sword - the seal of the Dunnadar.

GoodieHutType.Name: Fountain of the Oracle
GoodieHutType.Description: A statue of the fabled Oracle of Odenvell, crumbled to ruins, stands at the center of this ancient fountain...

Treasure.Title: Antheran Gold Pieces
Treasure.Desc: At the bottom of the well, you find a handful of these ancient coins.

Treasure.Title: The Oracle's Blessing
Treasure.Desc: Behind a partially crumbled wall, you find a flask containing a healing potion.

GoodieHutType.Name: Patrol of the Doomed
GoodieHutType.Description: Here lie a party of Free Riders - slaughtered by foes unknown.

Treasure.Title: Gold Pieces

Treasure.Title: Themisto's Manual of Armed Combat
Treasure.Desc: A rare find - a mostly intact copy of this highly-prized manual of fighting techniques.

GoodieHutType.Name: Cursed Hamlet
GoodieHutType.Description: The doorways of this abandoned hamlet all bear the sign of the White Eye - the emblem of dread Imperium. This village was cursed by the Titan Curgen.

Treasure.Title: Atalandran Longbow
Treasure.Desc: Such is this weapons craftsmanship that it remains as flexible and strong as the day it was carved.

Treasure.Title: Channeler's Gauntlets
Treasure.Desc: Hidden in an abandoned hut, you find these enchanted gauntlets.
